articles.title: FM Spokesman Discloses U.S. Intention of Claiming Implementation of "Resolution on Sanctions"
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Discloses U.S. Intention of Claiming Implementation of "Resolution on Sanctions"
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea Monday released the following statement:
					 Recently, the U.S. and its vassal forces rigged up the UNSC "resolution 2375" on sanctions harsher than ever against the DPRK branding its  measures to strengthen the state nuclear force as "a threat" to international peace and security, and released a UNSC "press statement" calling for the implementation of the "resolution" as a follow-up.
					
					 The anti-DPRK sanctions campaign of the U.S. has grown so reckless as to impose a full-scale blockade of all sections to include areas directly related to the livelihood of civilian population as well as foreign trade of the country.
					
					 This is the most vicious, unethical and inhumane act of hostility to physically exterminate the people of the DPRK, let alone its system and government.
					
					 What is more deplorable is that the U.S. is misleading public opinion by disseminating the fraudulent claim that the sanctions and pressure are geared to the so-called peaceful solution.
					
					  The U.S. is strangling and suffocating a country and breaking its will to impose U.S. intention upon it. Is it a peaceful and diplomatic solution?
					
					 The U.S. blustered that it would not rule out "military option" while making absurd assertion that the sanctions are a peaceful solution. This constitutes an open extortion against the international community as it implies that if they do not join the U.S.-led sanctions campaign against the DPRK, the U.S. will start a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The true intention of the U.S. is to appease the opposition from several countries against the escalation of tension and the outbreak of war in the Korean peninsula and the region and involve them in the sanctions and pressure campaign against the DPRK by all means.
					
					 Although the U.S. is acting so shameless and devious to justify the sanctions and pressure against the DPRK, it will not be able to delude even a single country.
					
					 It is a foolish dream to hope that the sanctions could work with the DPRK while the sanctions have failed to stop it from becoming a full-fledged nuclear weapons state and making rapid progress in the building of an economic power for more than half a century.
					
					 The increased moves of the U.S. and its vassal forces to impose sanctions and pressure on the DPRK will only increase our pace towards the ultimate completion of the state nuclear force.
					
					 The countries joining the U.S. in imposing sanctions on the DPRK should start working on a good explanation for the day when an actual balance of power is established between the DPRK and the U.S.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with a congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK led by Kim Chong, director of the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Industrial Establishments in Hamhung
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Industrial Establishments in Hamhung
Hamhung, September 18 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, made a field survey of the February 8 Vinalon Complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex and the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex.
					 Going round the complexes, the premier learned in detail about the production and expansion projects there.
					
					 At the consultative meetings, he underscored the need to bring about a boost in the production of Juche-oriented fertilizer, vinalon and custom-built equipment and finish the construction projects for expanding the production capacity through a drive for carrying out the behests of the leaders and honoring the party policies.
					
					 He also called on the relevant units to timely ensure raw and other materials in a responsible way.
					
					 Meanwhile, he stressed the measures to solve sci-tech issues arising in building the C1 chemical industry at the Hamhung branch of the State Academy of Sciences.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Mongolian President Khaltmaa Battulga on September 9.
					 In the message the Mongolian president extended heartfelt congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would boost in conformity with the regional peace and stability, he wished Kim Jong Un happiness in good health and the diligent Korean people big successes in their cause for prosperity and development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Azerbaijan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Azerbaijan
Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) - Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Sep. 6 received a message of greeting from Ilham Aliyev, president of Azerbaijan.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend heartfelt congratulations on my own behalf and on behalf of the people of Azerbaijan to you on the founding anniversary of the DPRK, its national day.
					
					 On this auspicious occasion, I send the best wishes to you and wish the friendly people of the DPRK peace and progress.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tunisian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tunisian President
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Tunisian President Mohamed Al Beji Caid Essebssi on September 11.
					 In the message the Tunisian president said he was happy to extend the warmest congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un on the national day of the DPRK. The message wished him good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and development.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Egypt
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Egypt
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Sep. 9 received a message of greeting from Abdel Fattah alÔºçSisi, president of the Arab Republic of Egypt.
					 The message said:
					
					 I am very pleased to extend heartfelt congratulations to Your Excellency on the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I affirm that I will actively strive to further develop the good relations of cooperation between the two countries in all fields.
					
					 I wish you good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Ceremony of Kindling Cauldron of 7th Int'l Martial Arts Games Held
articles.content:
Ceremony of Kindling Cauldron of 7th Int'l Martial Arts Games Held
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of kindling the cauldron of the 7th International Martial Arts Games took place here.
					 The cauldron, kindled at the flame holder of the games in Sports Village, Chongchun Street, will kindle the flame holder of the opening ceremony of the 7th International Martial Games to be held in Belarus in December this year.
					
					 Present there were Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, executive members of the IMAG Committee, the president of the Belarusian Taekwon-Do Association who is chairman of the Organizing Committee of the 7th International Martial Arts Games, those concerned for the games, staff members of foreign missions here, Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Martial Arts Federation and chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, officials concerned, Taekwon-do practicians, and working people, school youth and students in the city.
					
					 Speakers said that the games would mark an important occasion in boosting the solidarity among martial arts organizations of different countries and contributing to global peace.
					
					 Ri Yong Son handed torchlight to the torch holders.
					
					 They ran along Chongchun Street, holding the torchlight.

articles.title: First-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
articles.content:
First-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The first-day events of the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships took place at the Taekwon-Do Hall Monday.
					 Attending them were famous players who proved successful in the past championships.
					
					 The first-day events took place on a knock-out basis, divided into men's and women's pattern individual games from the first to fourth degrees and into men's and women's team pattern games.
					
					 The championships go on.

articles.title: Film Show Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Far Eastern Region of Russia
articles.content:
Film Show Marks Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Far Eastern Region of Russia
Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the People's Palace of Culture here on Monday to mark the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to the Far Eastern Region of Russian Federation.
					 Present there were So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, members of the association and working people in the city and Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean feature film "The Great Comrade Kim Jong Il Is a Veteran Statesman of the World".

articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman's Answer Distributed as UN Document
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman's Answer Distributed as UN Document
Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The answer given by a spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK to a question raised by KCNA as regards the fact that the U.S. and its vassal forces rigged up a "presidential statement" of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) condemning the medium-and-long range strategic ballistic rocket launching drill of the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army was distributed as an official document A/71/1034-S/2017/752 of the UN General Assembly and the UNSC on September 13.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Vol. 19 Published
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works" Vol. 19 Published
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Vol. 19 of "Complete Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works", a library of the immortal Juche idea, the Songun idea, was published in the DPRK.
					 The book contains 80 works including talks, speeches and concluding speeches made by leader Kim Jong Il in the period from November Juche 61 (1972) to March Juche 62 (1973).
					
					 The works show the greatness in idea and leadership of Kim Jong Il who saw to it that President Kim Il Sung was held in high esteem and the Party's monolithic ideological system thoroughly established and who brought about a new turning phase in all fields of socialist construction including politics, economy and culture.
					
					 They clarify the essence of the work to establish the Party's monolithic guidance system and the tasks for doing so in the field of literature and arts and other principled matters arising in developing our literature and arts to the Juche-oriented ones both in name and in reality.
					
					 The collection has encyclopedic works giving perfect answers to the theoretical and practical problems in the revolution and construction including the issue of steadily improving the educational method and attaching primary attention to the study of students at Kim Il Sung University and the issue of developing the trade union work as intended by the President.

articles.title: Development of Education in DPRK
articles.content:
Development of Education in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is registering great successes in researches to put education on a more scientific basis. The Education Institute is taking the lead in this work.
					 Recently, the institute completed and generalized a multimedia program on standard speed of the Korean language and multimedia programs for supporting teaching on a high level.
					
					 It also made a visual aid for giving common knowledge on geography and a multimedia program of geography to strengthen the education of the Korean geography.
					
					 It made visual aid boards to be put up at comprehensive knowledge learning rooms of the children's camps across the country in a short span of time and made a technical design for children's study and experience room to be newly arranged in the Natural History Museum.
					
					 It created useful and advantageous education methods and generalized them throughout the country.
					
					 It made five kinds of school thing designs for primary schools and kindergartens, contributing to improving education.
					
					 It newly drew up teaching program for education of the deaf, the blind and the dumb, completed sign language dictionary and sign languages of computer words and thus promoted the development of the education for the disabled.
					
					 It also built up a database on world universities and made tele-teaching reeducation programs for improving the teaching ability of the teachers.
					
					 Now, it has solved problems arising in teaching all subjects to implement the universal 12-year compulsory education program.

articles.title: Kim Yu Song, Forward of April 25 Sports Team
articles.content:
Kim Yu Song, Forward of April 25 Sports Team
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A talented forward good in scoring has emerged at the football circles of the DPRK. He is Kim Yu Song, a football player of the April 25 Sports Team. He is regarded as a "threatening player" in the defence position of the other team.
					 Kim scored 15 goals in total at 9 international games this year.
					
					 He scored five goals at the match between the April 25 Team and the Mongolia's Erchim team on March 14 and nine goals in four rounds of group league matches at the 2017 AFC Cup.
					
					 He played a big role to win the DPRK team's qualification for the 2018 AFC U-23 Championship.
					
					 He got four goals in three matches at the preliminary of the championship held in Pyongyang from July 19 to 23.
					
					 The DPRK team belonging to Group B for the 2019 AFC Asian Cup qualification recorded three goals in two matches. Two of them were scored by him.
					
					 According to experts, he has a good physical fitness and is quick in movement. Correct judgment and position option are his good points. 
					
					 He was selected as the top scorer in premier league football matches of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games last year.

articles.title: U.S. Is to Blame for Aggravated Situation of Korean Peninsula; KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Is to Blame for Aggravated Situation of Korean Peninsula; KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The world opinion asserts the justice of the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons at a time when it has become the focus of attention.
					 The director of the Swedish Institute for Security and Development Policy, at the press conference with the Swedish television, noted that the DPRK has faced a constant threat from the U.S. and it was a wise choice to have decided on developing nuclear weapons.
					
					 French website "Rupture Presse" said in an article that the DPRK's nuclear test wasn't a violation of international law as it withdrew from the NPT.
					
					 The article went on:
					
					 The DPRK tried to strike a peace accord with the U.S. to assure its security after the Korean War but the latter has turned a deaf ear to it for nearly half a century. Attempt to improve the DPRK-U.S. relations always "failed" due to the U.S. opposition. The DPRK came to a conclusion that the only way for escaping from the threat of aggression is to have access to nuclear deterrent and that's why the DPRK's access to practical and operational missiles tipped with nuclear warheads is the key to deterring outsiders from invasion and stabilizing the situation.
					
					 The Indian paper Hindustan Times said Trump pursues sanctions and pressure from which his predecessors had already suffered a flop and in fact they are regarded as war action because they are all-out economic blockade of the DPRK.
					
					 The former professor at Dallas university of the U.S. said that sanctions which the U.S. used as a main tool to effect its foreign policy, are in fact a war action tantamount to dropping bombs over the heads of the people.
					
					 A Russian expert asserted that crisis historically occurred owing to the joint military drills staged by south Korea and the U.S. and, in a nutshell, the main blame falls on the U.S. and south Korea.
					
					 British newspaper Daily Star, U.S. media Politico and other world media expressed concern over the fact that the U.S. is sending its cutting-edge military hardware to the Korean peninsula to step up its military muscle-flexing under the pretext of the DPRK's ICBM-ready H-bomb test.
					
					 What led to the DPRK's access to nuclear weapons? Who is chiefly to blame for the terrible situation on the peninsula which has reached an impasse today?
					
					 World media and experts have offered answers to this question.
					
					 The reality has proved the DPRK was entirely just when it has taken a series of toughest measures to defend itself from the U.S. constant military threat and moves of aggression.
					
					 The further the U.S. pursues military standoff with the DPRK, the worse its position will get.
					
					 Unless the U.S. renounces its anachronistic hostile policy and nuclear threat and blackmail toward the DPRK, the DPRK will more loudly beat the drum of victory declaring the ruin to the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Opening Avenue of Victory for Building Socialist Power with Great Advance of Self-Reliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Opening Avenue of Victory for Building Socialist Power with Great Advance of Self-Reliance
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial calls for opening a broad avenue for building a powerful socialist country with the great advance of self-reliance.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Self-development is the best and self-reliance is a way out. Only when their might is increased in every way, the final victory of socialism will be hastened. This is the revolutionary faith of the army and people of the DPRK they have cherished through the special events of September. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are now making desperate efforts to slap sanctions against the DPRK while pulling up the latter's measures to bolster up the state nuclear force as a "threat to global peace".
					
					 Meanwhile, big neighboring countries, which do not want to see the DPRK getting stronger and better-off but run counter to good faith and obligation without any principle and confidence, are following the U.S. action.
					
					 The prevailing situation calls for giving full play to the might of self-reliance, the lifeline and proud tradition of the Korean revolution and driving force of advancing socialism.
					
					 What we should rely on is our own strength and self-development is our greatest strength. The road to be followed by us is self-reliance and the short-cut to making a leap forward and bringing about innovations is self-reliance.
					
					 When we give fullest play to the might of self-reliance whose validity and vitality were proven in the tempest of history, our life and future and dignity of the country will be ensured, the final victory of the confrontation with the U.S. which has lasted for centuries be achieved and the firm guarantee for a new era of great power provided.
					
					 Let us resolutely frustrate the enemies' sanctions with heroic advance of self-reliance and pave the wider avenue of final victory for building a socialist power. This is the militant banner that we should uphold in the all-out do-or-die drive.
					
					 All Koreans should dynamically advance along the road of Juche and self-reliance and accelerate the final victory of building a socialist power under the leadership of the great Party.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Draw Lesson from Failed "North Policy"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Draw Lesson from Failed "North Policy"
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' "north policy" is now on the verge of going totally bankrupt in the face of strong denunciation and censure by the public at home and abroad, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 The "north policy" is extremely contradictory and completely unrealizable as its keynote is "simultaneous realization of dialogue and pressure", the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The present south Korean authorities clamored for "simultaneous realization of dialogue" and north-south relations while dancing to the tunes of the U.S. and the conservative forces' confrontation frenzy. This is an intolerable mockery and challenge to the DPRK and all Koreans including the candlelight demonstrators in south Korea.
					
					 It is quite natural that they are now hit hard from all sides for their preposterous "north policy".
					
					 They should come to their senses, though belatedly, and draw a due lesson from their miserable position.
					
					 When reading face of the U.S., which does not want the reconciliation and unity of the Korean nation, and the conservative group persistently opposed to the improved north-south relations, the south Korean authorities can neither be supported by the public nor get rid of the present crisis.
					
					 The mindset of the candlelight demonstrators in south Korea demands that the authorities hold hands with the fellow countrymen and opt for the path of peace and reunification from the stand of national independence, not getting hell-bent on the anti-DPRK racket of sanctions and pressure with outsiders and the conservatives.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should face up to the trend of the times and make a reasonable option.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Confrontation Racket under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Confrontation Racket under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday runs a commentary condemning the reckless moves of the south Korean warmongers frightened by Juche Korea's nuclear test.
					 The commentary says:
					
					 They, together with their masters, try to regularize deployment of the U.S. nuclear strategic assets, including strategic bombers, nuclear submarines and aircraft carriers, in the Korean peninsula from Guam, Japan and the U.S. mainland. Meanwhile, they push ahead with the introduction of multimode guided bombs for "precision strike" at the fixed or mobile targets of the DPRK and purchase of new weapons such as U.S.-made SM-3.
					
					 What cannot be overlooked is their clamor about examination of redeployment of the U.S. tactical nuclear weapons.
					
					 Their reckless behaviors are the hysteric fit of those horrified at the matchless military power of the DPRK and foolish efforts to calm down ever-growing "security uneasiness" in south Korea and make up for their strategic inferiority.
					
					 It is a big mistake to try to escape the destruction with the help of the U.S.
					
					 Their talking about regular deployment of the U.S. nuclear strategic assets on the Korean peninsula is an unpardonable treachery to turn the Korean peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia into a theatre of world thermonuclear war.
					
					 If they run amuck without capability of foresight and countermeasures to cope with consequences, they would only face the tragic end.
					
					 They should behave themselves after thinking twice about the catastrophic consequences from their imprudent behaviors.

articles.title: Thorough Elimination of Remnants of "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Thorough Elimination of Remnants of "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea Urged
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Traitor Park Geun Hye is a matchless dragon lady who turned whole of the south Korean land into a huge prison and a hell full of horror and disaster through the racket of reviving the "yusin" dictatorship, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It was a great misfortune for the south Koreans that Park, a descendent of "yusin" dictator, became the boss of Chongwadae, the article says, adding that the fascist frenzy kicked up by the traitor brought about the second dark era of "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 The present situation clearly proves that what a miserable end will entail if the remnants of the "yusin" dictatorship are not thoroughly abolished and its revival is allowed, it says, and goes on:
					
					 Park was severely punished by the people but the remnants of the "yusin" descendent still remain, challenging the mindset of the candlelight demonstrators.
					
					 Still the conservative forces are going on the rampage, branding the moves for abolishing the evil administration of Park Geun Hye as "political retaliation". Connivance at this will lead to the revival of the "yusin" dictatorship, and south Korean society can never achieve justice and progress.
					
					 If the "yusin" remnants are left intact, south Korea will face the same disgrace and misfortune as what it faced during the Park Geun Hye regime.

articles.title: DPRK Is Sure to Make Victory in Showdown with U.S.-led Imperialists: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Is Sure to Make Victory in Showdown with U.S.-led Imperialists: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is now emerging victorious in the showdown with the U.S.-led imperialists, staunchly foiling the enemies' anti-DPRK moves without any compromise and concession, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The history of the Korean revolution which was pioneered and has victoriously advanced by dint of self-development shows that only when one believes in one's own strength and enhance it, one can brave any hardship and difficulties, achieve greatest successes under the worst conditions, exalt the dignity and honor of one's country and nation and achieve the prosperity.
					
					 The signal achievements made in Juche Korea are fruition of the Korean people's spirit of self-reliance and self-development displayed under the wise guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Clear-cut is the stance of the Korean people toward the U.S. Unless the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threat are fundamentally removed, they will invariably follow the road of increasing the nuclear force, giving full play to the might of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 It is a daydream for the U.S. to stifle the DPRK as it is guided by the great Party and its people have the strong spirit of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 The world will see the brave spirit of Juche Korea emerging victorious in the showdown with the U.S. in the future, too.

articles.title: Regime's Human Rights Violation Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Regime's Human Rights Violation Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Five religious orders of south Korea held a press conference outside Chongwadae on September 13 to protest the authorities' indiscriminate crackdown on the religionists and other inhabitants at the time of the additional THAAD deployment, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 The fascist police on September 7 committed an outrage on office-bearers who took the lead in the actions against the additional THAAD deployment.
					
					 Recalling this fact, speakers at the conference branded such repression as a violation of human rights.
					
					 The religious organizations in a statement urged the puppet authorities to punish those responsible for the indiscriminate suppression and prevent the recurrence of such violation of the religionists' rights.

articles.title: S. Korea: Authorities' Racket of Sanctions against DPRK Protested
articles.content:
S. Korea: Authorities' Racket of Sanctions against DPRK Protested
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea held the 1138th Thursday rally on September 14 in demand of the release of prisoners of conscience and abolition of "Security Law". They denounced the regime for supporting the illegal anti-DPRK UNSC "sanctions resolution".
					 The speakers at the rally expressed aversion for the present regime, saying that its act of supporting the UNSC's adoption of "sanctions resolution" is little different from the acts of Park Geun Hye regime which had been hell-bent on escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen.
					
					 They called for clarifying the stand against the sanctions and protesting the UN's imposition of sanctions.
					
					 Justice of society can not be realized without releasing those who fought against the unjust forces and those who devoted themselves to peaceful reunification, they said, stressing the need for the present regime which came into existence by dint of the might of candlelight to set free all the prisoners of conscience within this year as demanded by the candlelight demonstrators.
					
					 They vowed to work harder to build a just society.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was brought out in booklet by the Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of  Russia on the occasion of the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The work published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012) deals with the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his noble career of loving the country and people.
					
					 It also indicates important matters arising in applying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on September 7.

articles.title: DPRK Founding Anniversary Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Founding Anniversary Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The 69th founding anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea was marked in different countries from Sept. 4 to 9.
					 Meetings and Korean book, photo, stamp and craftwork exhibitions took place in Mexico and Russia and friendship meetings in Romania and Syria.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books, photos and stamps introducing the DPRK and craftworks associated with creative talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico said Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK and turned it into a socialist country independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence and that Kim Jong Il pursued the unique Songun politics to firmly protect the dignity and sovereignty of the country despite all challenges of the imperialists.
					
					 The chairman of the Regional Social Organization of Russia "Borozino" said that the Korean people, united close around their leader, are making world-startling miracles such as perfect success of H-bomb test under the persistent sanctions and pressures by the U.S. and its vassal forces.
					
					 The secretary general of the Romania-Korea Friendship Association denounced the "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK cooked up by the UNSC under the control of the U.S. and strongly demanded the U.S. withdraw its forces for aggression from the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The secretary general of the People's Assembly of Syria stressed that all the successes of the Korean people greatly encourage the Syrian people's struggle against the common enemy.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed by Nepalese, Belarusian Personages
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed by Nepalese, Belarusian Personages
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Nepalese and Belarusian personages issued statements on September 3 and 4 hailing the DPRK's successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test.
					 Manju Ratna Sakya, chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, extended sincere congratulations to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un upon bringing about the great success in the ICBM-ready H-bomb test.
					
					 The test clearly proved that the DPRK reached a high level in the technology of designing and manufacturing nuclear weapons, he said.
					
					 Watching all victories won by the DPRK under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un, the world peace-loving people feel great joy, he noted.
					
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces should dare not provoke the DPRK possessed of powerful H-bomb and ICBM, he said.
					
					 L. Shukolinikov, chairman of the Belarus National Association of Friends of Korean People Named after Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, said that the successful H-bomb test is another victory won by the Songun politics of the DPRK, and its nuclear test and rocket launch are striking terror into the hearts of the imperialist invaders.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX critica intencion de EE.UU. de justificar la sancion anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX critica intencion de EE.UU. de justificar la sancion anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico el dia 18 una declaracion que sigue:
					  Recientemente, EE.UU. y sus satelites inventaron contra la RPDC la "resolucion de sancion" No.2375, la peor de la historia, describiendo el aumento de fuerzas armadas nucleares de nuestro pais como "amenaza" a la paz y seguridad internacionales y publicaron seguidamente un comunicado del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU que reclama la ejecucion de ese documento.
					
					  Ahora, la campana de sancion anti-RPDC de EE.UU. llego a la etapa imprudente de bloquear totalmente no solo las relaciones economicas con el extranjero, sino tambien los espacios directamente relacionados con la vida del pueblo.
					
					  Este acto hostil mas barbaro y antietico tiene por su objetivo eliminar fisica y totalmente nuestro regimen y poder y hasta a nuestro pueblo.
					
					  El problema es que EE.UU. engana la opinion publica difundiendo el sofisma de que la sancion y presion anti-RPDC son para la solucion pacifica.
					
					  ?Como puede ser la solucion pacifica y diplomatica el intento de una parte de doblegar la voluntad de la contraparte e imponerle su mandato al estrangularla y sofocarla?
					
					  EE.UU. insiste en que la sancion significa la solucion pacifica diciendo por otra parte que no descarta la "opcion militar", lo cual deviene el chantaje abierto de desatar la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana si la sociedad internacional no se suma a la sancion patrocinada por el.
					
					  Su intencion reside en calmar la repulsion de varios paises del mundo, que no desean la agravacion de tension y el estallido de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana y la region, e involucrarlos a toda costa en la sancion y presion anti-RPDC.
					
					  EE.UU. no puede enganar a nadie aunque actua descarada y ladinamente para justificar su campana de sancion y presion.
					
					  Seria muy absurdo pensar que vacilaria ante la sancion la RPDC que logra un desarrollo vertiginoso en la construccion de potencia economica ocupando dignamente la innegable posicion de potencia nuclear a pesar de la sancion de mas de medio siglo.
					
					  Cuanto mas recurran EE.UU. y sus satelites a la sancion y presion anti-RPDC, tanto mas crecera la velocidad de ella que marcha a galopes para completar las fuerzas armadas nucleares del Estado.
					
					  Seria bueno que los paises partidarios de la sancion anti-RPDC de EE.UU. piensen ya lo que diran cuando se logre realmente el equilibro de fuerzas entre la RPDC y EE.UU.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con grupo de felicitacion de coreanos residentes en Japon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con grupo de felicitacion de coreanos residentes en Japon
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea departio el dia 18 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el grupo de felicitacion de los coreanos residentes en Japon para el 69o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC, encabezado por el director del Instituto de la Historia de los Coreanos Residentes en Japon, Kim Chong.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju averigua en el terreno la situacion de empresas claves de Hamhung
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju averigua en el terreno la situacion de empresas claves de Hamhung
Hamhung, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y premier del Consejo de Ministros, averiguo en el terreno las gestiones del Complejo de Vinalon 8 de Febrero, el Complejo de Maquinaria de Ryongsong y el Complejo de Fertilizantes de Hungnam.
					  En su recorrido, el hizo conocimiento detallado del estado de produccion y ampliacion de la capacidad productiva de los complejos y convoco las reuniones de consulta.
					
					  En esas ocasiones, se discutieron los problemas tales como registrar innovacion en la produccion del abono Juche, el vinalon y los equipos encargados en el fragor de la lucha por materializar los legados de los lideres antecesores y defender las politicas del partido y terminar con antelacion la construccion de las facilidades para ampliar la capacidad productiva. Ademas, se debatieron los remedios para hacer a las unidades vinculadas abastecer a tiempo de las materias primas y materiales necesarios.
					
					  Por otra parte, el premier tomo en la Filial de Hamhung de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias las medidas para resolver los problemas cientificos y tecnicos presentados en la fundacion de la industria quimica de C1.

articles.title: Premier coreano se reune con miembros ejecutivos de ITF
articles.content:
Premier coreano se reune con miembros ejecutivos de ITF
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC, departio el dia 17 en el Palacio de Taekwondo con Ri Yong Son, presidente del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales (CIJAM) y de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwondo (ITF en ingles), y otros miembros ejecutivos de la ITF que participan en el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo.

articles.title: Efectuada 26a Asamblea General de ITF
articles.content:
Efectuada 26a Asamblea General de ITF
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 17 en esta capital la 26a Asamblea General de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwondo (ITF en ingles).
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Ri Yong Son, presidente del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales y presidente de ITF, los miembros ejecutivos de ITF, los presidentes de los comites permanentes, los titulares de las federaciones continentales, los delegados de las asociaciones nacionales y los funcionarios interesados.
					
					Los entrenadores del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea participaron en calidad de observador.
					
					La reunion hizo balance de los trabajos realizados despues de la 25a Asamblea General. Y fueron determinados los paises anfitriones del XIII Campeonato Mundial de Jovenes de Taekwondo y el VIII Campeonato Mundial de Veteranos de Taekwondo a ser efectuados en 2018, y el XXI Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo, en 2019, y fueron aprobados los documentos correspondientes como los modificados estatutos de ITF y los reglamentos de la competencia.

articles.title: Inaugurado XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Inaugurado XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurado el dia 17 en esta capital el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwondo con la participacion de las selecciones y delegaciones de 69 paises y regiones del mundo, inclusive la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					A lo largo de las calles desde la Villa de Taekwondo hasta el Palacio de Taekwondo, sede de la ceremonia inaugural, los trabajadores capitalinos dieron calida bienvenida a los participantes.
					
					En la ceremonia de inauguracion estuvieron presentes Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Kyong Ho, presidente del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea y del comite organizador del campeonato, y los funcionarios interesados y los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Se distinguian tambien Ri Yong Son, presidente de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwondo (ITF en ingles) y del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales, los miembros ejecutivos de ITF, los presidentes de los comites permanentes, los titulares de las federaciones continentales, los delegados de las asociaciones nacionales, los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas y de organizaciones internacionales en Corea y otros huespedes extranjeros.
					
					Aparecieron en la sede de inauguracion las selecciones de la RPDC, Rusia, Mongolia, Inglaterra y otros paises y regiones y la columna de arbitros.
					
					En su discurso de la ocasion, Kim Kyong Ho expreso agradecimiento a los participantes que dieron muestras de apoyo activo y solidaridad para la exitosa apertura del campeonato.
					
					Y hubo discursos de felicitacion.
					
					Pak Pong Ju deseo que los participantes promuevan la amistad y la unidad y pasen dias felices y alegres durante su permanencia en Pyongyang.
					
					Ri Yong Son expreso la conviccion de que los participantes manifestaran plenamente la superioridad y el poderio del Taekwondo ortodoxo haciendo uso de su alto nivel tecnico y nobles cualidades espirituales y morales.
					
					Tuvo lugar el juramento de los participantes.
					
					Acto seguido, se ofrecio una funcion artistica para felicitar la apertura del evento.

articles.title: Efectuada primera jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
articles.content:
Efectuada primera jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 18 en el Palacio de Taekwon-do la primera jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los medallistas que sobresalieron en los campeonatos anteriores.
					
					  La primera jornada se efectuo dividida en el pattern individual de ambos sexos y en el colectivo de ambos sexos desde primer grado hasta el cuarto, con el metodo de knock-out.
					
					  Continua el campeonato.

articles.title: Ceremonia de coleccion de antorcha para VII Competencia de Artes Marciales
articles.content:
Ceremonia de coleccion de antorcha para VII Competencia de Artes Marciales
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en esta capital la ceremonia de coleccion de antorcha para la VII Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales.
					La antorcha recogida en la Torre de Antorcha de Artes Marciales en la villa deportiva de la Avenida Chongchun se encendera en la torre de antorcha del lugar de ceremonia inaugural de la VII Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales que se efectuara en Belarus en diciembre que viene. 
					
					En la ceremonia participaron Ri Yong Son, presidente de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwondo (ITF en ingles) y del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales (CIJAM), los miembros ejecutivos del CIJAM, el presidente de la Asociacion de Taekwondo de Belarus y del comite organizador del presente certamen, los relacionados con artes marciales, los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas de varios paises en Corea, Kim Kyong Ho, presidente del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea y de la Federacion de Artes Marciales de Corea, los funcionarios interesados, los taekwondocas, los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes capitalinos. 
					
					Los oradores expresaron la seguridad de que la VII Competencia Internacional de Artes Marciales sera una importante oportunidad para fomentar la solidaridad de las organizaciones de artes marciales de varios paises y contribuir a la paz mundial. 
					
					  Ri Yong Son entrego la antorcha a los miembros encargados de prender. 
					
					    Ellos corrieron a lo largo de la Avenida Chongchun con la antorcha cogida.
